DOC.brief_title: Outcome Study ReDO Intervention Women With Stress-related Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: This project develop evaluate novel work rehabilitation program , Redesigning Daily Occupations ( ReDO ) , woman stress-related disorder . It co-operation project Lund University , Social Insurance Office , health care service County Halland . The ReDO intervention focus people compose everyday life . Supporting people change modify pattern daily occupation new intervention method people stress-related disorder , show effective improving quality life self-rated health target group . The basic idea re-structuring individual 's lifestyle pattern daily occupation lead healthy balance occupation everyday life , balance promote wellness increase work capacity . The program group base comprise 16 week , session 2 x 2 hour per week , follow 3-4 booster session . The aim research project evaluate outcome ReDO woman stress-related disorder . The hypothesis ReDO group improve comparison group receive `` care-as-usual '' ( CAU ) regard return work , sick leave , different aspect health well-being . group respect . The project quasi-experimental study . It cover time period enter program 12-month follow-up . According initial plan , first 50 woman enter ReDO program fit selection criterion would include . A power analysis indicate 40 individual group need detect medium effect size ( 0.6 ) 80 % power p < .05 . Forty-two woman actually recruit ReDO intervention . A matched comparison group select among client Social Insurance Office get ( CAU ) . The match make specific diagnosis , age , family situation ( civil status number child ) , type occupation duration sick leave . Thus , 84 woman take part project . The data consist registry information Social Insurance Office ( SIO ) questionnaires target socio-demographics , perceive stress , different aspect health well-being .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis Adjustment disorder Burnout Being sickleave > 2 month ( full time part time ) Having employment Other main diagnosis Adjustment disorder Burnout
